alert.note: Alert for East Washington Central Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 10 at 6:55AM PDT until September 10 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT SATURDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON CASCADES... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 696 East Washington Central Cascades (Zone 696). * Winds: East 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidities: 14 to 23 percent. * Impacts: Gusty winds along with very dry humidity could cause current and new fires to rapidly spread. * Additional Information: The east winds will be strongest for elevations 3000 feet or higher.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
